ingredients: 4 lb meaty cross-cut beef shanks (sometimes called beef shins; 1 1/2 inches thick)
1 (1/2-lb) piece boneless beef sirloin steak or tenderloin
1 lb dried flat thin or medium rice noodles (banh pho or pad Thai)
1/2 cup Asian fish sauce (preferably Vietnamese nuoc mam), or to taste

Accompaniments: fresh bean sprouts; very thinly sliced onion (rinsed and drained); fresh cilantro, mint, and basil (preferably Thai) leaves; thinly sliced scallions; lime wedges; thinly sliced fresh Thai or serrano chiles; Asian fish sauce (preferably nuoc mam)

directions: Heat oven to 375°F. Heat oil in a large ovenproof sauté pan over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt, pepper and herbes de Provence. Dust with flour; tap off excess. Cook, meaty side down, 5 minutes. Turn over; cook 1 minute. Add garlic and shallot; stir 30 seconds. Add wine; cook 1 minute. Add stock; cook 30 seconds. Add lemon juice. Transfer pan to oven. Bake until chicken is cooked through, 9 to 13 minutes. Transfer chicken to cutting board. Place pan over medium heat; simmer sauce 1 minute. Add butter; swirl pan until butter incorporates and sauce thickens slightly. Cut each breast into 4 slices; transfer each to a plate; top with sauce and garlic. Serve with spinach ; garnish with zest, if desired.
desc: Pollo Monte Cristo
title: Monte Cristo Chicken
ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 6 ounces each)

directions: Melt 3 tablespoons butter in large pot over medium-high heat. Add green onions and sauté until beginning to soften, about 2 minutes. Add next 5 ingredients. Bring to boil. Add mussels. Cover pot and increase heat to high. Cook until mussels open, 5 to 6 minutes.

Divide mussels among bowls (discard any mussels that do not open). Boil juices in pot to reduce slightly, about 1 minute. Whisk in remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon sauce over mussels; serve.
desc: Asian flavors add some heat to the classic French dish moules marinières.
title: Buttery Steamed Mussels with Sake and Chiles
ingredients: 6 Thai bird chiles with seeds or 3 small serrano chiles with seeds, sliced crosswise into thin rounds

directions: 1. Cut the fish into strips 1 1/2 inches long by 1/4 inch wide. Soak the strips in lightly salted water for 1 hour to tenderize. Drain well.
2. Put the fish in a bowl and fold in the lime juice carefully. Add the salt, garlic, and aji and refrigerate for 15 to 20 minutes.
3. Just before serving, mix in the parsley, cilantro, and onion.

4. To serve, line a bowl or large platter with the lettuce. Place the ceviche in the center. Surround it with 3 separate mounds: corn pieces at the top of the platter, sweet potato slices on one end, yucca on the other. Garnish with the seaweed, if using.
desc: Fish Salad Cooked in Lime Juice
title: Ceviche de Pescado
ingredients: 2 pounds white-fleshed skinless fish fillets such as flounder, sole, or corvina (cod)
1 small clove garlic, chopped very fine
1 or 2 fresh aji amarillo (yellow Peruvian chili), seeded and chopped fine, or substitute the canned aji
4 ears of corn, cooked and cut into 2-inch pieces
1 pound sweet potatoes, roasted in the skin, peeled, and sliced into 1/2-inch-thick rounds
1 pound yuca, peeled, cut into little-finger-sized slices, and boiled until soft
A few strands of yuyo (a tangy seaweed, optional)

directions: Pat neck and giblets dry. Heat oil in a heavy medium pot over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then brown neck and giblets, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes. Add vegetables and garlic and sauté until golden, about 5 minutes. Add wine and boil 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and briskly simmer, uncovered, until reduced to 4 1/2 cups, 45 minutes to 1 hour. (If you have less, add water; if you have more, continue to reduce.) Strain through a large sieve into a large bowl, discarding solids. Skim off and discard fat.
desc: Classic Italian stock vegetables enhance this amber-gold broth for an unbeatable gravy that really complements the turkey.
title: Turkey Giblet Stock
ingredients: Neck and giblets (excluding liver) from turkey

directions: Cut lamb into 2 pieces where there is a natural separation in meat and put each piece into a large sealable plastic bag.

In a food processor, purée all remaining ingredients (except relish) until smooth and divide marinade evenly between plastic bags. Seal bags, pressing out excess air, and put in a shallow baking pan. Marinate lamb, chilled, turning bags once or twice, at least 8 hours or overnight.
Prepare grill.

Discard marinade and grill lamb in batches if necessary on an oiled rack set 5 to 6 inches over glowing coals 7 to 10 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Transfer lamb to a cutting board and let stand 10 minutes.
Serve lamb, thinly sliced across the grain, with relish.
In a heavy saucepan, stir together ingredients and simmer, stirring occasionally, about 1 hour, or until reduced to about 3 cups. Relish may be made 1 month ahead and chilled, covered.
Serve relish chilled or at room temperature.
title: Grilled Leg of Lamb with Hot Red Pepper Relish
ingredients: a 7- to-8 pound leg of lamb, trimmed of excess fat, boned, and butterflied by butcher (4 to 4 3/4 pounds boneless)
2 pounds red bell peppers, chopped fine (about 4 cups)
1 teaspoon crushed dried hot red pepper flakes

directions: Mix first 6 ingredients in 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Add steak and turn to coat. Marinate 1 hour at room temperature or refrigerate up to 6 hours, turning steak occasionally.

Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat) or preheat broiler. Drain marinade into small saucepan; boil 1 minute and reserve to pass as sauce. Grill or broil steak to desired doneness, about 4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Transfer steak to platter. Thinly slice across grain. Serve with marinade.
desc: "My father was a grilling fanatic,: Sandra says. "I remember him standing over the barbecue in a terrible rainstorm one day when he just had to have grilled chicken. He named this marinade after the village in Italy where he grew up."
title: Grilled Beef Steak Verciano

directions: Sprinkle 2 tablespoons thyme, coarse salt and pepper on baking sheet. Roll tenderloin in spice mixture. Cover; chill 3 hours.
Mix olive oil, capers, parsley, shallot and 1 tablespoon thyme in bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Let stand 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Heat vegetable oil in heavy large skillet over high heat. Add tenderloin; cook until brown on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer to baking sheet. Roast until meat thermometer inserted into center registers 125°F. for rare, about 12 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Serve tenderloin with salsa.
desc: Team this dish with roasted potatoes, green beans tossed with shallot butter, and a bottle of Pinot Noir. To finish, buy a lemon cheesecake from your favorite bakery.
title: Beef Tenderloin with Salsa Verde

directions: Cover work surface with plastic wrap and put steak on it with a short side of steak nearest you. Holding a sharp knife parallel to work surface and beginning on a long side, using short slicing motions, butterfly steak by cutting it horizontally almost, but not all the way, in half, then open it like a book.
Cover steak with a double thickness of plastic wrap (about 2 feet long) and, using the flat side of a meat pounder (or using a rolling pin), gently pound meat 1/4 inch thick.

Discard top sheets of plastic wrap and turn steak on plastic wrap so grain of meat is running left to right, then rub 1 tablespoon oil onto steak and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Arrange prosciutto in a slightly overlapping layer on steak, then cover with cheese.

Beginning with side nearest you, using plastic wrap as an aid and pressing slightly on filling, roll up steak tightly, then skewer steak, crosswise, at 1-inch intervals. Using a sharp knife, cut between skewers to make 1-inch-thick pinwheels. (End pieces will be about 1 1/2 inches thick. Trim if desired. For more about how to form beef pinwheels, see Time for Steak, Rattle, and Roll.)

Prepare grill for cooking over medium-hot charcoal (moderate heat for gas). If using a charcoal grill, open vents on bottom of grill, then light charcoal. When charcoal turns grayish white (about 15 minutes from lighting), hold your hand 5 inches above grill rack to determine heat for charcoal as follows:
Hot: When you can hold your hand there for 1 to 2 seconds
Medium-hot: 3 to 4 seconds
Low: 5 to 6 seconds
If using a gas grill, preheat burners on high, covered, 10 minutes, then, if necessary, reduce to heat specified in recipe.

Grill pinwheels, cut sides down, on a well-oiled rack, turning over once (use a metal spatula to loosen), until beef is well browned outside but still pink inside and cheese is beginning to melt, 6 to 8 minutes total.
Toss arugula with remaining 2 tablespoons oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Serve on a platter, topped with pinwheels.
title: Beef Pinwheels with Arugula Salad
ingredients: Special equipment: 8 to 10 (6-inch-long) wooden skewers, soaked in water 30 minutes

directions: In a 4- to 6-quart heavy saucepan bring wine and water to a boil with onion, carrot, celery, spices and salt and simmer 20 minutes. Add oil and halibut and poach fish at a bare simmer, covered, until just cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes. Transfer fish with a slotted spoon to 2 plates. Spoon court bouillon over fish. Sprinkle fish with fresh coriander and garnish with lemon wedges.
desc: Traditionally used for poaching seafood, court bouillon (French for "quick broth") is an aromatic stock made with vegetables and herbs. Wine, lemon juice, or vinegar is often added.
title: Halibut in Spiced Court Bouillon
ingredients: 2 teaspoons chopped fresh coriander leaves (wash and dry before chopping)

directions: Prepare grill for cooking over direct heat with hot charcoal (high heat for gas; see Grilling Procedureepi:recipelink.</epi:recipelink>
While grill is heating, coarsely crush peppercorns with a mortar and pestle or by wrapping them in a kitchen towel and pressing with bottom of a heavy skillet.

Pat steaks dry and sprinkle both sides with salt and crushed pepper, pressing to help adhere. Grill steaks on lightly oiled grill rack (covered only if using a gas grill), turning over once and moving around to avoid flare-ups if necessary, 6 to 8 minutes total for medium-rare. Transfer steaks to a cutting board and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 5 minutes. Thinly slice steaks diagonally.
desc: In true Argentine and Uruguayan fashion, the steak is simply seasoned with salt and pepper, so the quality of the ingredients is particularly important. This is a well-marbled cut, which makes for a juicy and full-flavored grilled steak.
title: Grilled Skirt Steak

directions: Oil grill rack. Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Toss first 6 ingredients in medium bowl to blend. Season salsa generously with salt and pepper.
Brush fish with 1 tablespoon oil. Spread seasoning in dish. Dredge fish in seasoning, turning to coat. Grill fish until just opaque in center, about 4 minutes per side. Serve with salsa.
desc: Jamaican jerk seasoning — a blend of chiles, thyme, garlic, onion, and spices — gives the grilled fish a reddish-brown finish. It's a supermarket staple now; look for it in the spice aisle. Serve with: Rice salad and grilled squash.
title: Grilled Mahi-Mahi with Avocado-Melon Salsa

directions: Place 1/4 teaspoon coarse salt and garlic on work surface. Using flat side of knife blade, smash garlic and salt together until paste forms. Transfer garlic paste to medium bowl. Add orange and yellow tomatoes, olives, cilantro, 3 tablespoons olive oil, capers, lime juice, chopped jalapeño chiles, and dried oregano; toss relish to blend well. Season relish to taste with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: Can be prepared 1 hour ahead. Let stand at room temperature.

Sprinkle steaks on both sides with cumin, 3/4 teaspoon pepper, and 2 teaspoons coarse salt. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in heavy large skillet over high heat until very hot, about 2 minutes. Add steaks. Sear steaks until browned and cooked to medium-rare, 6 to 7 minutes per side. Transfer steaks to cutting board and let rest 10 minutes.
Thinly slice steaks crosswise. Overlap slices on plates. Serve with relish.
desc: A colorful mix of orange and yellow tomatoes looks great with the seared steaks. The relish would also be terrific with fish or spooned atop crostini that have been spread with fresh goat cheese.
title: Seared Rib Eye Steak with Tomato-Caper Relish
ingredients: 3/4 pound orange and yellow vine-ripened tomatoes, cut into 1/3-inch cubes
2 1/4 teaspoons finely chopped pickled jalapeño chiles

directions: Heat oil in large pot over high heat. Add bones and onions and cook until brown, turning mixture over and scraping bottom of pot frequently, about 25 minutes. Add 1 cup water and boil until reduced to glaze, scraping bottom frequently, about 8 minutes. Add remaining 6 cups water, wine, tomato and cloves. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 4 hours. Strain stock into bowl, pressing on solids. Chill at least 1 hour. (Can be made 4 days ahead.)
Remove fat from surface of stock. Boil stock in medium saucepan until reduced to 2 cups, about 30 minutes.

Melt margarine in heavy 14-inch skillet or Dutch oven over high heat. Add chopped shallots and rosemary and sauté 2 minutes. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until juices are released, stirring frequently, about 10 minutes. Add stock and boil until sauce coats spoon lightly, about 15 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. (Can be made 3 days ahead. Refrigerate. Rewarm ragout over low heat.) Add degreased pan juices from roast if desired.
title: Red Wine Mushroom Ragoût
ingredients: 5 pounds meaty beef neck bones, cut into 2-inch pieces

directions: Blend 1/4 cup tuna, anchovy, mayonnaise, oil, capers, and lemon juice in a blender until smooth to make tonnato sauce.
Pulse eggplant, garlic, parsley, zest, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a food processor until combined but not smooth.
Toss tomatoes with mint, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Divide eggplant mixture among jars and layer remaining tuna (broken up into large chunks), tonnato sauce, croutons, and tomatoes (including juices) on top. Drizzle with olive oil.
desc: Dressing up jarred eggplant and canned tuna results in an incredibly lusty lunch. An easy tomato and mint salad spooned on top adds just the right touch of fresh acidity.
title: Tuna Tonnato with Eggplant Salad
ingredients: 2 (6-ounce) cans light tuna packed in olive oil (preferably Italian), drained, divided
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus additional for drizzling
2 (11 1/2- to 13-ounce) jars or containers grilled eggplant, drained
2 cups (1/2-inch) bread cubes from a country loaf, toasted
Equipment: 4 (16-ounces) wide jars or containers with lids

directions: Preheat oven to 375°F.

Cut just enough bread into 1/3-inch pieces to measure 1 cup and spread evenly in a shallow baking pan. Toast bread in middle of oven, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 10 minutes, then transfer to a bowl. Leave oven on (for pork).

Cook shallots in butter in a large nonstick skillet over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 10 minutes. Add apricots and cook, stirring, until slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in bread, parsley, salt, and pepper.

Make a hole for stuffing that runs lengthwise through pork loin: Beginning in middle of 1 end of roast, insert a sharp long thin knife lengthwise toward center of loin, then repeat at opposite end of loin to complete incision running through middle.
Open up incision with your fingers, working from both ends, to create a 1 1/2-inch-wide opening, then pack with all of stuffing, pushing from both ends toward center.
Pat pork dry and and season well with salt and pepper.

Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over high heat until very hot and just smoking, then brown pork on all sides, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a roasting pan and roast in middle of oven until a meat thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into meat (avoid stuffing) registers 160°F, 45 to 50 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and let stand 20 minutes.
While loin is standing, straddle roasting pan across 2 burners. Add 1/2 cup water and deglaze pan by boiling over moderate heat, scraping up brown bits.
Slice meat and serve with sauce.
title: Roast Pork with Apricot and Shallot Stuffing
ingredients: 1/2 lb firm-ripe apricots (3 large), cut into 1/3-inch pieces
1 (3- to 3 1/2-lb) center-cut boneless pork loin roast (3 1/2 inches in diameter), not tied

directions: Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté 6 minutes. Add beef and sausage and sauté until brown, breaking up meats with back of fork, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes with juice, broth, beans, 1 cup basil, oregano, and dried crushed red pepper. Simmer 15 minutes to blend flavors, stirring occasionally. Add pasta and cook until tender but still firm to bite, about 15 more minutes. Add spinach and cook just until wilted, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Mix in 1/3 cup cheese and remaining 1/2 cup basil. Season ragout with salt and pepper; ladle into bowls. Serve, passing additional cheese separately.
title: Pasta, Sausage, and Bean Ragoût
ingredients: 2 14 1/2-ounce cans diced tomatoes in juice with garlic, oregano, and basil

directions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Cut artichokes into 1/2-inch pieces. Sprinkle baking sheet with yellow cornmeal. Unroll pizza crust dough onto prepared baking sheet; press out dough to 11-inch square. Brush dough with 1 tablespoon reserved marinade. Top dough with artichokes, plum tomato slices, crumbled herb-seasoned feta cheese and sweet onion slices. Drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon marinade.
Bake pizza until crust is crisp and golden, about 15 minutes. Transfer to platter. Sprinkle with mint. Cut pizza into 4 squares and serve.
desc: With the pizza, serve a green salad tossed with white-wine vinaigrette and pine nuts. Finish with lemon ice cream topped with pureed raspberries.
title: Artichoke and Feta Cheese Pizza
ingredients: 1 6.5-ounce jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained, 2 tablespoons marinade reserved
6 ounces plum tomatoes, thinly sliced into rounds
1 cup crumbled herb-seasoned feta cheese (about 4 ounces)
1/2 medium-size sweet onion (such as Vidalia or Maui), thinly sliced

directions: Mix 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon chopped garlic, and 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes in a small bowl. Season one 1-pound 1 1/4"-thick strip steak with 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Coat with Dijon mustard mixture. Cover and chill for 4 hours. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Build a medium-hot fire in a charcoal grill, or heat a gas grill to high. Grill steak, about 7 minutes per side for medium-rare. Finish with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice.
desc: Tim Love, Woodshed Smokehouse, Fort Worth, TX: "Charred mustard and citrus make for a great combo, especially when combined with a marbled steak."
title: Mustard-Citrus Grilled Steak
ingredients: a squeeze of fresh lemon juice

directions: Thinly slice shallots. In a 12-inch ovenproof heavy skillet cook bacon in batches over moderate heat, turning it, until golden but still flexible (not crisp) and drain on paper towels. In fat remaining in skillet cook shallots over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened. Transfer shallots with a slotted spoon to a small bowl and leave any fat remaining in skillet. Preheat oven to 300°F.

Put each chicken breast half between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and with smooth side of a meat pounder pound each breast to 1/8-inch thickness. Discard plastic from boned side of each breast and season chicken with lemon pepper and salt. Arrange 2 1/2 bacon slices lengthwise (parallel with grain of flesh) along middle of each breast and top with shallots and Parmesan. Using plastic wrap as an aid, tightly roll up each breast lengthwise, tucking in ends to enclose filling, and secure seams with wooden picks.

Add oil to reserved fat in skillet and heat over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking. Brown roulades all over, turning them, about 5 minutes total. Transfer skillet to middle of oven and bake roulades until just cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.

While roulades are baking, mince garlic. Transfer chicken to a plate with tongs and keep warm, covered. Pour off fat from skillet. Add wine to skillet and deglaze over moderately high heat, scraping up brown bits. Boil wine until reduced to about 1 tablespoon and add garlic and butter. Cook mixture over moderately low heat, stirring, until fragrant. Add flour and cook roux, stirring, 1 minute. Add broth and cream and bring to a boil, whisking. Simmer sauce, whisking, 2 minutes and pour through a fine sieve into a small saucepan. Keep sauce warm. Carefully discard wooden picks from roulades and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch slices. Spoon some sauce in center of each of 4 plates and arrange roulade slices decoratively on sauce.
title: Chicken Bacon Roulades
ingredients: 4 skinless boneless chicken breast halves (about 1 1/2 pounds total)

directions: Boil first 5 ingredients in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat until mixture is reduced to 1 1/2 cups, about 35 minutes. Mix 2 tablespoons butter and flour in small bowl to form paste. Whisk paste into sauce; simmer until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes. Strain into heavy small saucepan. Preheat oven to 450°F. Place lamb on baking sheet. Spread mustard over lamb. Mix breadcrumbs, cheese, parsley, butter and garlic in small bowl; press onto lamb. Bake lamb to desired doneness, about 25 minutes for medium-rare. Bring sauce to simmer. Mix in olives. Cut lamb between ribs into chops. Serve with sauce.
desc: Offer this elegant dish with a sauté of vegetables.
title: Rack of Lamb with Port and Black Olive Sauce
ingredients: 2 cups beef stock or canned beef broth
2 cups chicken stock or canned low-salt chicken broth
2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature
3/4 cup (packed) fresh breadcrumbs from crustless French bread
3/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese (about 2 1/4 ounces)

directions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Heat 1 inch oil in a 10-inch heavy pot (2 to 3 inches deep) over moderate heat until a deep-fat thermometer registers 360°F.
Meanwhile, separate tortillas and make 2 stacks of 6 to 8. Wrap each stack in foil and heat in oven 12 to 15 minutes.

While tortillas warm, stir together flour and salt in a large bowl, then stir in beer (batter will be thick). Gently stir fish into batter to coat. Lift each piece of fish out of batter, wiping any excess off on side of bowl, and fry fish in batches, turning once or twice, until golden, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
Increase oil temperature to 375°F and refry fish in batches, turning once or twice, until golden brown and crisp, about 1 minute. Drain on paper towels.
Assemble tacos with warm tortillas, fish, and accompaniments.
title: Fried Fish Tacos
ingredients: 1 pound cod fillet, cut into 3- by 1-inch strips
Accompaniments: shredded lettuce, sour cream, avocado slices, chopped or sliced radish, red or green salsa, and lime wedges

directions: Preheat broiler.
Purée cilantro, oil, chiles with some adobo sauce, water, cumin, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a blender until smooth, then coat fish with sauce.
Line rack of a broiler pan with foil, then broil fish 3 to 4 inches from heat until just cooked through, 6 to 9 minutes.
desc: Mild tilapia takes beautifully to a robust, smoky cilantro-chipotle sauce.
title: Cilantro-Chipotle Tilapia
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped canned chipotles in adobo

directions: Season brisket with salt. Wrap tightly in plastic and chill at least 8 hours.
Let brisket sit at room temperature 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Combine mustard, brown sugar, and ginger in a small bowl. Unwrap brisket, place on a wire rack set inside a large rimmed baking sheet, and rub mustard mixture all over brisket. Roast until top is nicely browned, 30–40 minutes.
Remove brisket from oven and reduce oven temperature to 300°F.

Meanwhile, heat bacon fat in a large heavy ovenproof pot over medium heat. Add onions; season with salt and cook, stirring often, until deep golden brown, 8–10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low, add flour, and cook, stirring often, until mixture smells nutty, about 4 minutes. Add bay leaf, ale, and stock. Bring to a simmer. Add brisket, cover, and transfer to oven. Braise, turning every 30 minutes, until fork-tender, 3–4 hours. Discard bay leaf.
Transfer brisket to a cutting board and let rest at least 20 minutes.

If braising liquid is thin, bring to a boil, reduce, and simmer, skimming surface as needed, until thick enough to coat a spoon; season with salt, if needed. Slice brisket against the grain. Serve with braising liquid.
DO AHEAD: Brisket can be braised 2 days ahead. Cover and chill in braising liquid.
desc: The flat cut of brisket is leaner than the point cut (or deckle) but still has enough fat to keep it juicy. It will hold its shape better as it cooks, and slices neatly.
title: Belgian Ale-Braised Brisket
ingredients: 2 tablespoons bacon fat or vegetable oil
4 cups beef stock or low-sodium chicken broth

directions: Bring vermouth and raisins to a boil in a small saucepan, then remove from heat and let steep until raisins are soft and plump, about 15 minutes.

Cook onion in oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender but not browned, 5 to 8 minutes. Add chard, raisins with any remaining vermouth, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and cook over medium heat, turning chard constantly with tongs, until chard is tender and liquid has evaporated, about 12 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and stir in nuts, then cool.

Cutting as close to bones as possible, make 1 long incision to separate meat of each rack from bones, stopping 1/2 inch from bottom (do not cut all the way through). Roll meat away from bones to create a long opening, then season inside with salt and pepper and fill with stuffing. Roll meat back over stuffing, then tie meat to bones with string (between every 2 ribs).
Preheat oven to 400°F with rack in middle.

Stir together mustard, thyme, and rosemary and spread over both sides of each rack. Put racks of lamb in a large shallow heavy baking pan, pairing racks so that they stand up with their bones interlocking but leaving space between them at base.
Roast lamb until an instant-read thermometer inserted into center of meat (do not touch bone) registers 130°F for medium-rare, 25 to 35 minutes. Let stand, loosely covered, 15 minutes.
Cut each rack into 4 double chops, discarding string, and serve on top of roasted red peppers.
desc: Your subconscious will register "early spring" with this combination of double-thick lamb chops and earthy, grassy Swiss chard. Perfect for Easter dinner, the dish is heightened by the tang of Dijon mustard and the subtle sweetness of plump golden raisins.
title: Rack of Lamb with Swiss Chard
ingredients: 2 large bunches green Swiss chard (1 pound total), stems and center ribs reserved for another use and leaves coarsely chopped
4 (8-rib) frenched racks of lamb (each about 1 1/2 pound), trimmed of all but a thin layer of fat

directions: Combine first 7 ingredients in large bowl. Divide steaks, bell peppers and red onions among large shallow pans. Pour marinade over. Turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate 3 to 6 hours.

Prepare barbecue (high heat). Drain steaks and vegetables. Grill steaks to desired degree of doneness, about 4 minutes per side for rare. Transfer to platter. Grill vegetables until beginning to brown, about 4 minutes per side. Slice steaks thinly across grain. Arrange steaks and vegetable on large platter. Serve with grilled rolls, allowing diners to assemble sandwiches.
title: Grilled Flank Steak, Onion and Bell Pepper Sandwiches
ingredients: 6 large bell peppers (red, yellow and/or green), cut into 3/8-inch wide strips
3 large red onions, cut into 1/2-inch-thick rings

directions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Mix garlic, 2 Tbsp. dill, 1 Tbsp. lemon zest, 1 Tbsp. lemon juice, 1 Tbsp. oil, 1 1/2 tsp. kosher salt, and pepper in a small bowl with a fork to create a paste. Pat pork tenderloin dry and rub with paste.

Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high. Sear pork, turning occasionally, until golden brown on all sides, 10–12 minutes. Add tomatoes, then transfer to oven and roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of pork registers 145°F and tomatoes are lightly blistered and softened, about 10 minutes. Transfer pork to a cutting board and let rest at least 5 minutes before slicing.

Meanwhile, whisk remaining 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, and 1 tsp. kosher salt in a medium bowl. Add arugula, farro, peas, feta, and remaining 3 Tbsp. dill and 1 Tbsp. lemon zest; toss well to combine (arugula will wilt slightly when dressed). Gently fold in roasted tomatoes.
Slice pork and transfer to a platter; season with sea salt, if using. Serve with farro salad alongside.
Pork can be marinated 4 hours ahead; keep chilled. Let sit at room temperature 30 minutes before cooking.
desc: This recipe is part of our Spring Grocery Bag Menu featuring 5 easy weeknight dinners made from 1 grocery bag of ingredients.
title: Dill-Crusted Pork Tenderloin With Farro, Pea, and Blistered Tomato Salad
ingredients: 2 tablespoons finely grated lemon zest, divided

directions: Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add leek; sauté 3 minutes. Add mussels and wine. Cover and simmer until mussels open, about 4 minutes (discard any that do not open). Using slotted spoon, transfer mussels to 2 bowls.
Stir cream and 2 tablespoons parsley into liquid in pot. Simmer uncovered 3 minutes. Season sauce with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over mussels. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons parsley.
desc: Serve these mussels with a frisée salad dressed with red wine vinaigrette. Add french fries, plus a baguette for sopping up the sauce. Lemon tart would be good for dessert.
title: Mussels in Cream Sauce
ingredients: 1 small leek, halved, thinly sliced (white and pale green parts only)

directions: In a large jar with a tight-fitting lid combine marinade ingredients with salt and pepper to taste and shake until combined well.

In a large resealable plastic bag combine fillet with marinade and seal bag, pressing out as much air as possible. Turn bag several times to coat fillet with marinade and put in a shallow dish or bowl. Marinate fillet, chilled, turning bag every few hours, at least 8 hours or overnight. Let fillet stand at room temperature 30 minutes before grilling.
Prepare grill.

Grill fillet on an oiled rack set about 5 to 6 inches over glowing coals, turning every 5 minutes to evenly sear all sides, until it registers 130°F. to 135°F. on a meat thermometer, about 25 to 30 minutes, for medium-rare. (Alternatively, fillet may be roasted in an oiled roasting pan in a preheated 500°F. oven approximately the same amount of time.) Transfer fillet to a cutting board and let stand 10 minutes.
Slice fillet and serve with vinaigrette.
title: Grilled Fillet of Beef with Tomato Ginger Vinaigrette
ingredients: 2 tablespoons finely grated peeled fresh gingerroot
1 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes
a 2 1/2- to 3-pound fillet of beef, trimmed and tied

directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.

2. Place the chicken pieces and flour in a large resealable plastic bag and toss to coat evenly. Shake off any excess flour. Place the chicken, fennel, shallots, and garlic in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the salt and black and white peppers. Bake until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy, 40 to 45 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley before serving.
desc: Kosher Status: Poultry
title: Crispy Salt and Pepper Chicken with Caramelized Fennel and Shallots
ingredients: 2 large fennel bulbs, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch slices

directions: Position rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 325°F. Place ham on rack set in large roasting pan. Using sharp knife, score ham in diamond pattern. Press 1 clove into center of each diamond. Pour 4 cups water into roasting pan. Roast ham 1 hour 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, blend marmalade, horseradish, and sugar in medium bowl.

Remove ham from oven. Transfer ham to baking sheet. Discard pan juices. Return ham to roasting pan. Add orange juice to roasting pan. Brush top of ham with 1/3 of marmalade glaze. Bake ham 10 minutes. Baste with orange juice in pan, then brush with half of remaining glaze. Bake ham 10 minutes. Baste with orange juice in pan and brush with remaining glaze. Roast ham until heated through, basting every 5 minutes, about 20 minutes longer. Let ham rest 15 minutes. Transfer to platter. Serve ham hot, warm, or at room temperature.
desc: Although labeled fully cooked, the ham will still need a gentle baking for maximum tenderness and flavor. Be sure the Cranberry Mustard and the Whole Wheat Date Rolls are close at hand and that the ham is sliced thin for those who would like to make small sandwiches.
title: Baked Ham with Marmalade-Horseradish Glaze
ingredients: 1 18-pound fully cooked bone-in smoked ham, room temperature

title: Cuppa Cuppa Cuppa (Artichoke Dip)
ingredients: 1 cup artichoke hearts, cut into bite size pieces
directions: Mix everything together
Sprinkle a little extra parmesan cheese on top
Warm in the oven at 325 degrees for about 20 minutes
Serve with crackers, crusty bread slices, or whatever suits

title: Aunt Heidi's Fondue
directions: Rub garlic on the bottom and side of pot
Add wine and heat
Add grated cheeses gradually, stirring constantly
Make a roux with flour and add to thicken
Add a few squeezes of lemon
Season with nutmeg and white pepper
Add kirsch if using
Serve with crusty bread

title: Mak's Fart Soup (Chipotle Black Bean & Sweet Potato)
ingredients: 1-2 tablespoons adobo sauce from canned chipotles
1 large sweet potato, peeled and finely diced
directions: Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and pinch of salt, sauté 3-5 minutes until translucent
Add garlic, cumin, and adobo sauce; sauté 1-2 minutes
Add sweet potato, beans, and vegetable broth. Bring to boil
Reduce heat to medium; simmer 12-15 minutes until sweet potatoes are tender
Transfer ~2 cups to blender and blend until smooth (or use immersion blender)
Stir in lime juice and season with salt
Top with cilantro, avocado, etc.

title: Creamy Cauliflower Soup with Rosemary Oil
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, broken into florets
directions: Make rosemary oil: combine olive oil and rosemary in skillet, cook on low 5 minutes. Pour into bowl to cool
In dutch oven, heat 2 tbsp olive oil. Add onions, cook 6-8 minutes until tender
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds
Add stock, cauliflower, salt and pepper. Bring to boil, then simmer 10 minutes
Make croutons with remaining rosemary oil and bread cubes
Blend soup in batches with 1/4 cup rosemary oil until creamy
Serve with rosemary oil swirl, croutons, and lemon zest

title: Jack Bayley's Chili
directions: Cook ground beef and onion over medium heat until browned, about 5-7 minutes
Stir in tomato sauce, kidney beans, and stewed tomatoes with juice
Add water if you prefer thinner consistency
Season with chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper
Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 minutes
notes: Stupid easy chili ready in less than an hour. Can add adobo chilies, frozen corn, black beans, diced tomatoes and green chilis.

title: Aunt Heidi's Chicken Noodle Soup
directions: Add butter, celery and carrots to stock pot over medium-high heat. Sauté 3 minutes
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds
Add chicken stock and season with rosemary, sage, red pepper, salt and pepper
Bring to boil
Add chicken from rotisserie chicken. Taste and adjust seasonings
Cook egg noodles separately according to package (leave al dente)
Add noodles to soup when serving to prevent sogginess

title: Chicken Quinoa Wild Rice Salad
ingredients: 1 package Seeds of Change Quinoa Brown and Red Rice
directions: Microwave quinoa and rice, let cool
Add diced chicken, cucumber, onion, olives, feta and parmesan. Mix
Add balsamic vinaigrette and toss
Serve hot or cold

title: Chicken Pecan Salad
directions: Mix pecans with pepper sauce, butter, sugar, Worcestershire, lemon, salt. Spread on baking sheet
Bake pecans at 350F for 10 minutes, stirring often (watch closely - easy to burn!)
Rub chicken with olive oil and Greek seasoning
Bake chicken at 350F for 20+ minutes until done
Cut chicken into strips
Mix with romaine, chopped fruit, and pecans
Drizzle with honey mustard dressing

title: Napa Cabbage Salad
directions: Chop scallions and shred cabbage. Set aside
Crush ramen noodles. Brown in 1-2 tbsp vegetable oil with almonds and sunflower seeds
Mix all dressing ingredients in a jar, making sure sugar is dissolved
Combine cabbage, scallions, ramen mix and add dressing before serving

title: Vegan Dan Dan Noodles
ingredients: 1/4 cup fried soy beans or peanuts
directions: Make sauce: combine soy sauce, chili oil, black vinegar, ketchup, wine, sugar, and cornstarch
Boil noodles according to package, drain but don't rinse
In large pan, cook shallot in oil 3-4 minutes. Add peppercorn, garlic, and veggie ground
Break up veggie ground and cook 8-10 minutes until browned
Add sauce, simmer 2 minutes. Add bok choy, cover and cook 4-5 minutes
Toss with noodles, garnish with green onion and peanuts

title: Aunt Julie's Party Mash Potatoes
directions: Boil and mash the potatoes
Cream in cream cheese, sour cream, and butter
Add onion salt and pepper
Spread in 9x13 casserole dish, top with paprika
Heat in oven before serving
notes: Thanksgiving at the farm wouldn't be the same!

title: Jack's Cauliflower Cheese
directions: Chop cauliflower into florets and boil until al dente. Set aside
Grate all cheese and set aside
Melt butter in large non-stick pan on low/medium heat
Add flour and stir to make a creamy roux. Add mustard if using
Add milk 1/4 cup at a time, stirring constantly to prevent lumps
Add 2/3 to 3/4 of cheese and stir until melted
Put cauliflower in oven-proof dish, pour cheese sauce over
Top with remaining cheese
Broil or bake to brown the cheese
notes: Jack Bayley's favorite - can be a side or meal on its own

title: Nick Bayley's Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: Herbs to taste (thyme, rosemary, or Italian seasoning)
Black pepper and salt to taste
Optional: frozen peas or red peppers
directions: Cook onions and garlic in olive oil until soft and translucent
Add rice and stir while cooking for 1 minute. Make sure oil coats the rice
Add white wine and cook until absorbed
Add stock about a cup at a time, stirring while it absorbs
Add mushrooms, peas, herbs and anything else you fancy
Keep adding stock and stir while it absorbs. Rice is done when soft
Turn off heat and stir in cheese. Add butter if desired
Let sit 5 mins. Garnish with parsley if you want to impress
notes: Serves 4 normal people or 2 Marc Kannegiesers

title: Jack Bayley's Red Thai Curry
ingredients: 1 small (4 oz) can Thai red curry paste (Maesri brand)
directions: Reduce coconut cream over medium-high heat until it breaks and oil separates (looks like melted marshmallows)
Add curry paste and whisk. Reduce again until oil slick appears on top
Add coconut milk and whisk. Add galangal, lemongrass, garlic, and kaffir leaf
Simmer 20 minutes until thickened
Add meat/veggies and cook until tender
Pull off heat and add fish sauce, lime juice, and salt to taste
Note: Fish sauce should always be added at end - if heated too much it turns bitter

title: Chicken Enchilada Suizas
ingredients: 6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (1.5 lbs)
directions: Poach chicken in boiling water 15-20 minutes. Drain, cool, and shred
Sauté onion and peppers in butter until soft, 5-8 minutes
Mix with chicken, cheddar, green chiles, salsa, cilantro, cumin. Season to taste
Grease 9x15 baking pan. Fill tortillas with 1/3 cup mixture, roll up and place seam-down
Sprinkle Monterey Jack over enchiladas
Combine cream and broth, pour over enchiladas
Cover with foil, bake at 350F for 30 minutes
Remove foil, bake 10 more minutes. Garnish with avocado, tomato, cilantro
notes: This is a Millay Christmas Eve tradition

title: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 2.5 lbs boneless skinless chicken breasts, cubed
directions: Heat olive oil. Cook onion, garlic, ginger 2-3 minutes until fragrant
Stir in butter, stock, tomato paste, cinnamon, salt, cumin, garam masala, turmeric
Bring to simmer, add chicken and coat. Cover and cook 15 minutes
Stir in lemon juice and heavy cream. Simmer 2 more minutes
Serve over rice, sprinkle with cilantro

title: Middle Eastern Black Beans, Chickpeas and Rice
directions: Heat oil, cook garlic 1 minute
Add rice and spices, cook 3 minutes until rice is coated
Add chicken stock, bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover, simmer 20+ minutes
Brown turkey in skillet (add onion if desired)
Drain and rinse beans, fold into rice with turkey
Add herbs and serve. Add cholula and greek yogurt on top!
notes: Izzy makes this at least 1x/month. Great to make on Sunday for the week!

title: Mom's Chicken Divan (Memother's Recipe)
directions: Cook chicken breasts or use rotisserie chicken, cut into pieces
Steam broccoli and cut into small pieces
Mix sauce: soup, mayo, evaporated milk, cheese, and curry
Layer in baking dish: chicken on bottom, broccoli on top
Pour sauce over everything, mix slightly
Top with crushed potato chips
Bake at 350F for 30 minutes until bubbling
Serve with rice!

title: Aunt Heidi's Slow Cooker Shredded Chicken
directions: Layer chicken in slow cooker. Add broth, oil, garlic powder, onion powder, lemon peel, bay leaf
Season with 1 tsp salt and pepper. Cook high 3 hours or low 6 hours
Transfer to bowl, shred with 2 forks
Drizzle with 1/2 cup cooking broth, season and toss
notes: Variations: Buffalo (butter + hot sauce), Lemon Herb (parsley + lemon + dill), Barbecue (BBQ sauce)

title: Aunt Heidi's Chicken Pot Pie
directions: Melt butter, cook onion and carrot until soft, about 6 minutes
Add flour and 1/2 tsp salt. Cook until pale golden, about 5 minutes
Whisk in broth, bring to boil, stir until thick (8 min). Simmer 10 minutes
Stir in chicken, peas, thyme. Season. Pour into 2-quart baking dish, refrigerate 20 min
Roll pastry to 1/8 inch thick, cut 1 inch larger than dish
Top dish with pastry, cut vents. Brush with egg wash
Refrigerate 15 min. Bake at 375F until deep golden, about 35 minutes

title: Aunt Gigi's Fancy Pants Chicken
ingredients: 1 envelope Lipton's Savory Herb soup mix
directions: Layer chicken and prosciutto in deep baking dish
Cover with spinach and chopped vegetables
Mix soup with water and oil, pour over dish
Cover loosely, bake at 375F for 30 minutes
Remove, top with mozzarella
Bake uncovered for 10 more minutes

title: Miso-Honey Chicken and Asparagus
directions: Make marinade: whisk miso, honey, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger, garlic, chile sauce, 1 TBSP oil, 1 TBSP water
Refrigerate half for serving. Marinate chicken in remainder
Heat broiler with rack 6 inches below. Line baking sheet with foil
Place chicken on one side of sheet, asparagus on other. Drizzle asparagus with remaining oil
Broil until chicken is cooked with charred spots, about 20 minutes
Serve with reserved marinade and rice

title: Carmen's Easy Meatballs
directions: Mix bread crumbs, bread pieces, and milk in bowl. Let sit to absorb
Add hamburger, beaten egg, and bread mixture to bowl
Mix by hand until just combined
Roll into tablespoon-sized balls, place on parchment-lined sheet
Swirl ketchup on top (optional)
Bake at 400F for 25 minutes
notes: Makes ~20. Can also bake in sauce with mozzarella at 400F for 30 minutes.

title: Izzy's Asian Slow Cooker Pulled Pork & Slaw
directions: Sauté sesame oil, onions, garlic, ginger over high heat
Take off heat, stir in hoisin sauce, fish sauce, 1/4 cup water, sriracha
Spoon some mixture into slow cooker, add pork, spoon rest on top
Cook on low 5-7 hours until pork shreds easily
Make slaw: mix rice vinegar, ginger, oils, then add cabbage, carrots, cucumber, pear
Shred pork with forks. Serve over rice with slaw and warm tortillas

title: Bucatini with Sausage and Peas
directions: Heat olive oil, cook sausage over medium-high until browned, about 8 minutes
Add garlic and shallot, cook 2 minutes
Add tomato sauce, simmer partially covered for 30 minutes
Stir in cream and peas, simmer 10 more minutes. Season with salt
Cook pasta according to instructions, drain and return to pot
Add sauce and parmesan, toss to coat
Serve with more cheese and basil

title: Pork Stir Fry with Green Beans
directions: Mix sauce: soy sauce, cooking wine, sugar, chili garlic sauce
Trim and chop beans into 1-inch pieces
Heat 1.5 tbsp oil in skillet until smoking. Add beans, cook 2.5 minutes total until charred but tender-crisp. Remove
Turn heat to medium-high, add 1 tbsp oil. Cook onion, garlic, ginger 1 minute
Turn heat to high, add pork and cook 2 minutes, breaking up
Add sauce, cook 30 seconds. Add beans, stir 30 seconds
Serve over rice

title: Millay Family Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: Melt butter and let cool
Whisk in sugars until well combined
Beat in eggs and vanilla
Add salt, flour, baking soda, mix until just combined
Add chocolate chips
Chill dough overnight (or else you get flat cookies!)
Bake at 370F for 10-15 minutes

title: Joanne Chang's Ginger Molasses Cookies
ingredients: 3/4 cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled
directions: Combine butter, brown sugar, molasses, and egg until well mixed
Mix flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and salt
Stir dry ingredients into butter mixture
Refrigerate overnight (or 3-4 hours)
Scoop 1/4-cup balls, roll in granulated sugar
Place 2 inches apart on baking sheet
Bake at 350F for 16-18 minutes until crackly on top

title: Gingersnap Cookies
directions: Cream together butter and sugar
Add eggs and molasses
Gently mix in dry ingredients
Roll into 1 inch balls and roll in sugar
Bake at 350F for 8-9 minutes

title: Mom's Hermit Bars
directions: Boil raisins with water, cool, and drain
Cream butter and sugar, then add egg
Add dry ingredients
Fold in raisins last
Spread in greased 9x13 pan
Bake at 350F for 30 minutes
Sprinkle with sugar after baking
notes: The real champion of every ski race

title: Aunt Jeanne's Brownies
directions: Cream softened butter, eggs, and brown sugar together
Microwave chocolate 1:15, let cool
Add flour and cooled chocolate to the butter mixture
Optional add-ins: walnuts, chocolate chips, instant coffee, cinnamon, citrus zest, coconut
Pour into buttered 9x13 pan
Bake at 350F for 25-30 minutes

title: Mom's Peanut Blossoms
ingredients: 1/2 cup white sugar (plus extra for rolling)
directions: Preheat oven to 375F
Mix wet ingredients first, then fold in dry ingredients
Roll mixture into balls and roll in white sugar
Cook for 10 minutes
When done, place chocolate kiss on top

title: Virginia Trafton's Carrot Cake
directions: Beat oil and sugar on top speed for 5 minutes
Add eggs one at a time and beat
Sift dry ingredients and fold in, mixing minimally
Fold in grated carrots
Pour into greased pans (two 9-inch rounds or 9x12 sheet)
Bake at 350F for 55-60 minutes
Make frosting: combine cream cheese, butter, confectioners sugar, vanilla until smooth
Let cake cool 20 minutes, then frost

title: Aunt Heidi's Blueberry Cake
directions: Mix dry ingredients together
Cream butter and sugar, then add egg
Add dry ingredients to wet mixture
Add milk
Coat blueberries with 1 tbsp flour, gently fold in last
Sprinkle extra sugar on top
Bake at 350F in 8x8 pan for 30ish minutes until toothpick comes out clean

title: Mom's Moo Moo Chocolate Cake with Coffee Frosting
directions: Grease and flour cake pan
Mix wet ingredients (minus coffee)
Slowly fold in dry ingredients
Add cup of hot coffee
Bake at 350F for an hour
Let cake cool completely before icing
Frosting: Mix instant coffee with milk, set aside
Beat butter, confectioner's sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla until smooth
Add coffee mixture and frost cake
notes: 4th of July favorite - goes well with strawberry ice cream

title: Mom's Apple Cake
directions: Grease an 8x8 inch pan
Mix sugar, mayo, milk, and egg together
Add flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves
Add peeled & chopped apples and raisins
Bake for 35-40 minutes at 350F

title: Aunt Julie's Fruit Glazé Pie
directions: Bake pie shell according to instructions
Let pie shell cool, pour in 3 cups of fruit (halve strawberries, peaches sliced)
In saucepan, mash remaining 1 cup fruit. Add sugar, water, cornstarch
Cook on medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened
Spread mixture over fruit in pie shell
Refrigerate at least 1 hour to set

title: Aunt Gigi's Blueberry Crumb Pie
directions: Press pie dough into 9 inch pie plate, crimp edges
Mix blueberries, sugar, tapioca, cinnamon, vinegar. Pour over pie shell
Blend crumble ingredients (flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, margarine). Spread over filling
Bake at 350F for ~50 minutes. Cover edges with foil if browning too fast

title: Cliff Dweller's Pie
directions: Whip cream cheese and add sweetened condensed milk (mix until almost doubled in volume)
Blend avocado with lemon and lime juice, fold in zests
Add avocado mixture to cream cheese mixture and blend well
Pour into graham cracker pie shell
Chill and serve

title: Sophia's Famous Banana Bread
ingredients: 2 tablespoons creme fraiche or sour cream
directions: Set oven to 350F. Line loaf pan with parchment
Sift together flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt
Beat sugar and eggs with whisk until light and fluffy, about 10 minutes
Drizzle in oil. Add mashed bananas, creme fraiche, vanilla
Fold in dry ingredients and nuts
Pour into lined loaf pan
Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour

title: Jack Bayley's Dutch Oven Crusty Bread
directions: Combine yeast, sugar, and warm water. Let proof 5 minutes until foamy
Add flour, mix until dough comes together. Add salt and mix until incorporated
Cover and let rise 1 hour until doubled
Tip dough onto floured board. Shape by folding corners toward center, flip and pull into round loaf
Place seam-down in floured bowl, cover and let rise 30 minutes
Preheat oven to 460F with dutch oven inside
Tip dough onto parchment, seam side up. Transfer to hot dutch oven, cover
Bake covered 30 minutes. Remove lid, bake 10-15 more minutes until brown
Cool on rack at least 30 minutes before cutting

title: Mom's Cornbread
ingredients: 1 cup buttermilk (or 1 cup milk + 1 TBSP vinegar)
directions: Beat molasses, buttermilk and egg together
Add dry ingredients
Add melted butter
Spread into buttered 8x8 pan
Bake for 15-20 minutes at 400F - check at 15 mins

title: Mom's Date Bread
directions: Beat egg and vanilla
Add dry ingredients
Add dates and pecans
Bake at 350F for 35 minutes
notes: The best part about Christmas morning

title: Aunt Leslie's Pumpkin Bread
directions: Cream shortening and sugar thoroughly
Add eggs, pumpkin and water; blend thoroughly
Blend in dry ingredients gradually
Pour into two greased tins
Bake at 350F for 50-60 minutes
